revised_title: Magnetic Observations in the Antarctic Expedition
tldr: The author presents the results of magnetic observations made during the Antarctic Expedition under the command of Captain Sir James Clark Ross. The observations were conducted on board the ships Erebus and Terror, and the data collected was used to deduce the constants a and b for the corrections of the ship's attraction. The study provides insights into the changes in magnetic conditions during the expedition and the impact of the ship's magnetic properties on the observations.
